column4: i have a nvidia 8800 gts  which has 2 outputs, i want to use one for monitor and other for hdmi to the tv, i was able to do this in windows, anyone know how i can do this in ubuntu

enable the restricted driver at System>Admin>Hardware drivers.. then open a terminal and type sudo apt-get install nvidia-settings.. you'll find that after install at System>Admin>Nvidia x server settings..
i get the error: Could not get lock /var/lib/dpkg/lock - open (11 Resource temporarily unavailable)
do you have Synaptic open? or is auto update running?
ahh silly me yes i do
or "add remove programs" ?
do i have to restart, it seems to have finished installing
nope.. that's windows thinking.. just check System>Admin>Nvidia <something>
i dont see it, can i just type nvidia-settings in terminal?
yes

sometimes it won't show until the next X restart.. or you can force it to show by right mouse clicking on "Applications" and choose "Edit Menus".. then navigating to the appropriate location and removing the check mark and then replacing it..
ahh i think i still have to restart for the comp to recognize the hdmi input
wait
do you have a direct HDMI output and a DVI AND a VGA?
there's a section in nvidia-settings that you have to activate the alternate output.. but will only work after hooking it to the secondary monitor.
well it is hooked up, i guess i just have to find the option
x server Display configuration
im not sure waht you mean by that
in nvidia-settings.
hopefully someone else will pick this up.. I've gotta run.. sorry.. good luck
i got it working so
thanks a lot <3
cool
